intro: Molina scabra, commonly known as the rough molina, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine areas. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes other plants known for their medicinal properties. Molina scabra is adapted to cold climates and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
